div1.p: Keen sends a contribution for Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from W.W. Keen to Howard A. Kelly, July 27, 1907
div1.opener:
L.
L.
Victoria Hotel
P. O. Persen
Loen Norway
Christiania July 27 1907 My dear Dr Kelly
div1.p:
I am sending you #5 for
the brave soldier - Kissinger
I thinkis his name - whose case
was noticed in the Outlook- The
man who risked his life volun-
tarily & quietly to prove the theorytruth
of the mosquito theory of Yellow
Fever. No more courageous act
was ever done. It was far greater
than the courage shown by the
soldier amid the excitement &
the incitement of battle. I ear-
nestly hope Congress will give him
a pension.
